datasets.name: NSIDC SMMR-SSM/I Nasateam sea ice concentration
datasets.description: Passive-microwave estimates of sea ice concentration at 25km spatial resolution. Daily and monthly resolution, available from 1-Oct-1978 to present.
datasets.citation: Cavalieri, D. J., C. L. Parkinson, P. Gloersen, and H. Zwally. 1996, updated yearly. Sea Ice Concentrations from Nimbus-7 SMMR and DMSP SSM/I-SSMIS Passive Microwave Data. [indicate subset used]. Boulder, Colorado USA: NASA National Snow and Ice Data Center Distributed Active Archive Center. http://dx.doi.org/10.5067/8GQ8LZQVL0VL

datasets.name: NSIDC SMMR-SSM/I Nasateam near-real-time sea ice concentration
datasets.description: Passive-microwave estimates of sea ice concentration at 25km, daily, near-real-time resolution.
datasets.citation: Maslanik, J. and J. Stroeve. 1999, updated daily. Near-Real-Time DMSP SSMIS Daily Polar Gridded Sea Ice Concentrations. [indicate subset used]. Boulder, Colorado USA: NASA National Snow and Ice Data Center Distributed Active Archive Center. http://dx.doi.org/10.5067/U8C09DWVX9LM

datasets.name: NSIDC passive microwave supporting files
datasets.description: Grids and other support files for NSIDC passive-microwave sea ice data.
datasets.citation: See the citation details of the particular sea ice dataset used

datasets.name: NSIDC SMMR-SSM/I Nasateam sea ice time since melt
datasets.description: Time since sea ice melted calculated from NSIDC SMMR-SSM/I Nasateam sea ice concentration data

datasets.name: Nimbus Ice Edge Points from Nimbus Visible Imagery
datasets.description: This data set (NmIcEdg2) estimates the location of the North and South Pole sea ice edges at various times during the mid to late 1960s, based on recovered Nimbus 1 (1964), Nimbus 2 (1966), and Nimbus 3 (1969) visible imagery.
datasets.citation: Gallaher, D. and G. Campbell. 2014. Nimbus Ice Edge Points from Nimbus Visible Imagery L2, CSV. [indicate subset used]. Boulder, Colorado USA: NASA National Snow and Ice Data Center Distributed Active Archive Center. http://dx.doi.org/10.5067/NIMBUS/NmIcEdg2

datasets.name: Artist AMSR-E passive microwave sea ice concentration
datasets.description: Passive-microwave estimates of daily sea ice concentration at 6.25km spatial resolution, from 19-Jun-2002 to 2-Oct-2011.
datasets.citation: Include the acknowledgement: "ASI Algorithm AMSR-E sea ice concentration were obtained for [PERIOD] from the Integrated Climate Date Center (ICDC, http://icdc.zmaw,de/), University of Hamburg, Hamburg, Germany." Also please cite: Spreen, G., L. Kaleschke, and G. Heygster (2008), Sea ice remote sensing using AMSR-E 89 GHz channels, J. Geophys. Res. 113, C02S03, doi:10.1029/2005JC003384

datasets.name: Artist AMSR-E passive microwave supporting files
datasets.description: Grids and other support files for Artist AMSR-E passive-microwave sea ice data.
datasets.citation: See the citation details of the particular sea ice dataset used

datasets.name: Artist AMSR2 near-real-time passive microwave sea ice concentration
datasets.description: Near-real-time passive-microwave estimates of daily sea ice concentration at 6.25km spatial resolution, from 24-July-2012 to present.
datasets.citation: Spreen, G., L. Kaleschke, and G. Heygster (2008), Sea ice remote sensing using AMSR-E 89 GHz channels, J. Geophys. Res. 113, C02S03, doi:10.1029/2005JC003384
datasets.comment: The source_url here points to a specific year, but somehow wget gets into the other yearly directories (and this doesn't recurse properly if it gets pointed to the parent directory) so just accept it for now

datasets.name: Artist AMSR2 regional passive microwave sea ice concentration
datasets.description: Passive-microwave estimates of daily sea ice concentration at 3.125km spatial resolution in selected regions, from 24-July-2012 to present.
datasets.citation: Spreen, G., L. Kaleschke, and G. Heygster (2008), Sea ice remote sensing using AMSR-E 89 GHz channels, J. Geophys. Res. 113, C02S03, doi:10.1029/2005JC003384
datasets.comment: The source_url here points to a specific year, but somehow wget gets into the other yearly directories (and this doesn't recurse properly if it gets pointed to the parent directory) so just accept it for now

datasets.name: Artist AMSR2 passive microwave supporting files
datasets.description: Grids for Artist AMSR2 passive-microwave sea ice data.
datasets.citation: See the citation details of the particular sea ice dataset used

datasets.name: CERSAT SSM/I sea ice concentration
datasets.description: Passive microwave sea ice concentration data at 12.5km resolution, 3-Dec-1991 to present

datasets.name: Smith and Sandwell bathymetry
datasets.description: Global seafloor topography from satellite altimetry and ship depth soundings
datasets.citation: Smith, W. H. F., and D. T. Sandwell, Global seafloor topography from satellite altimetry and ship depth soundings, Science, v. 277, p. 1957-1962, 26 Sept., 1997

datasets.name: Kerguelen Plateau Bathymetric Grid 2010
datasets.description: This data replaces the digital elevation model (DEM) for the Kerguelen Plateau region produced in 2005 (Sexton 2005). The revised grid has been gridded at a grid pixel resolution of 0.001-arc degree (about 100 m). The new grid utilised the latest data sourced from ship-based multibeam and singlebeam echosounder surveys, and satellite remotely-sensed data. Report Reference: Beaman, R.J. and O'Brien, P.E., 2011. Kerguelen Plateau bathymetric grid, November 2010. Geoscience Australia, Record, 2011/22, 18 pages.
datasets.citation: Beaman, R.J. & O'Brien, P., 2011. Kerguelen Plateau Bathymetric Grid, November 2010. Record  2011/022. Geoscience Australia, Canberra

datasets.name: NOAA Optimum Interpolation 1/4 Degree Daily Sea Surface Temperature Analysis
datasets.description: Sea surface temperature at 0.25 degree daily resolution, from 1-Sep-1981 to present
datasets.citation: Richard W. Reynolds, Viva F. Banzon, and NOAA CDR Program (2008): NOAA Optimum Interpolation 1/4 Degree Daily Sea Surface Temperature (OISST) Analysis, Version 2. [indicate subset used]. NOAA National Climatic Data Center. doi:10.7289/V5SQ8XB5 [access date]

datasets.name: NOAA Optimum Interpolation Sea Surface Temperature V2
datasets.description: Weekly and monthly mean and long-term monthly mean SST data, 1-degree resolution, 1981 to present. Ice concentration data are also included, which are the ice concentration values input to the SST analysis
datasets.citation: NOAA_OI_SST_V2 data provided by the NOAA/OAR/ESRL PSD, Boulder, Colorado, USA, from their web site at http://www.esrl.noaa.gov/psd/

datasets.name: NOAA Extended Reconstructed Sea Surface Temperature V3b
datasets.description: A global monthly SST analysis from 1854 to the present derived from ICOADS data with missing data filled in by statistical methods
datasets.citation: NOAA_ERSST_V3 data provided by the NOAA/OAR/ESRL PSD, Boulder, Colorado, USA, from their web site at http://www.esrl.noaa.gov/psd/

datasets.name: Ssalto/Duacs gridded absolute dynamic topography
datasets.description: Gridded sea surface heights above geoid from satellite altimetry (delayed and near-real-time products)
datasets.citation: The altimeter products were produced by Ssalto/Duacs and distributed by Aviso, with support from Cnes (http://www.aviso.altimetry.fr/duacs/)

datasets.name: Ssalto/Duacs gridded absolute geostrophic velocities
datasets.description: Absolute geostrophic velocities computed from gridded sea surface heights above geoid from satellite altimetry  (delayed and near-real-time products)
datasets.citation: The altimeter products were produced by Ssalto/Duacs and distributed by Aviso, with support from Cnes (http://www.aviso.altimetry.fr/duacs/)

datasets.name: Ssalto/Duacs gridded sea level anomalies
datasets.description: Gridded sea surface height anomalies from satellite altimetry  (delayed and near-real-time products)
datasets.citation: The altimeter products were produced by Ssalto/Duacs and distributed by Aviso, with support from Cnes (http://www.aviso.altimetry.fr/duacs/)

datasets.name: Ssalto/Duacs gridded mean and climatological sea level anomalies
datasets.description: Monthly mean and monthly climatologies of gridded sea surface height anomalies from satellite altimetry
datasets.citation: The altimeter products were produced by Ssalto/Duacs and distributed by Aviso, with support from Cnes (http://www.aviso.altimetry.fr/duacs/)

datasets.name: GSHHG coastline data
datasets.description: A Global Self-consistent, Hierarchical, High-resolution Geography Database
datasets.citation: Wessel, P., and W. H. F. Smith, A Global Self-consistent, Hierarchical, High-resolution Shoreline Database, J. Geophys. Res., 101, 8741-8743, 1996

datasets.name: Polar environmental data layers
datasets.description: These layers are climatological and other summary layers that may be useful for purposes such as general modelling, regionalisation, and exploratory analyses
datasets.citation: Raymond, B (2012, updated 2014) Polar Environmental Data Layers Australian Antarctic Data Centre - CAASM Metadata (https://data.aad.gov.au/aadc/metadata/metadata_redirect.cfm?md=/AMD/AU/Polar_Environmental_Data)

datasets.name: Oceandata MODIS Aqua Level-3 binned daily remote sensing reflectance
datasets.description: Daily remote-sensing reflectance from MODIS Aqua. RRS is used to produce standard ocean colour products such as chlorophyll concentration
datasets.citation: See http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/cms/citations

datasets.name: Oceandata SeaWiFS Level-3 binned daily remote sensing reflectance
datasets.description: Daily remote-sensing reflectance from SeaWiFS. RRS is used to produce standard ocean colour products such as chlorophyll concentration
datasets.citation: See http://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/cms/citations

datasets.name: NASA MODIS Rapid Response Antarctic Mosaic
datasets.description: Daily Antarctic MODIS mosaic images at 4km resolution
datasets.citation: See https://earthdata.nasa.gov/earth-observation-data/citation-policies

datasets.name: CSIRO Atlas of Regional Seas 2009
datasets.description: CARS is a digital climatology, or atlas of seasonal ocean water properties.
datasets.citation: Ridgway K.R., J.R. Dunn, and J.L. Wilkin, Ocean interpolation by four-dimensional least squares -Application to the waters around Australia, J. Atmos. Ocean. Tech., Vol 19, No 9, 1357-1375, 2002

datasets.name: NCEP-DOE Reanalysis 2 6-hourly data
datasets.description: NCEP-DOE Reanalysis 2 is an improved version of the NCEP Reanalysis I model that fixed errors and updated paramterizations of of physical processes. The 6-hourly data is the original output time resolution.
datasets.citation: NCEP_Reanalysis 2 data provided by the NOAA/OAR/ESRL PSD, Boulder, Colorado, USA, from their web site at http://www.esrl.noaa.gov/psd/

datasets.name: NCEP-DOE Reanalysis 2 daily averages
datasets.description: NCEP-DOE Reanalysis 2 is an improved version of the NCEP Reanalysis I model that fixed errors and updated paramterizations of of physical processes. Daily averages are calculated from the 6-hourly model output.
datasets.citation: NCEP_Reanalysis 2 data provided by the NOAA/OAR/ESRL PSD, Boulder, Colorado, USA, from their web site at http://www.esrl.noaa.gov/psd/

datasets.name: NCEP-DOE Reanalysis 2 monthly averages
datasets.description: NCEP-DOE Reanalysis 2 is an improved version of the NCEP Reanalysis I model that fixed errors and updated paramterizations of of physical processes. Monthly averages are calculated from the 6-hourly model output.
datasets.citation: NCEP_Reanalysis 2 data provided by the NOAA/OAR/ESRL PSD, Boulder, Colorado, USA, from their web site at http://www.esrl.noaa.gov/psd/
